slide.title: EUS-guided PV Intervention
slide.text: EUS-guided PV Intervention 1Department of Internal Medicine, Chuncheon Sacred Heart Hospital, Hallym University College of Medicine, Chuncheon, Korea 2Division of Gastroenterology, Department of Internal Medicine, Asan Medical Center, University of Ulsan College of Medicine, Seoul, Korea <Asian EUS Summit 2016> Tae Young Park1, Dong-Wan Seo2

slide.title: Introduction
slide.text:
Introduction EUS-guided vascular therapy has expanded to include PV intervention.
EUS-guided PV intervention EUS-guided PV stenting EUS-guided PV embolization EUS-guided PV pressure measurement
Overview of EUS-guided PV intervention in experimental evaluation.
Weilert F, Binmoeller KF. Gastrointestinal Endoscopy Clinics of North America 2012;22:303-314

slide.title: Contents
slide.text: Contents 1) EUS-guided PV stenting 2) EUS-guided PV embolization 3) EUS-guided PV pressure measurement

slide.title: Indications for PV stenting
slide.text: Indications for PV stenting Malignant PV obstruction - Hepatocellular carcinoma with main PV invasion - Pancreatic cancer with main PV invasion - Biliary cancer with main PV invasion Yamakado K, Tanaka N, Nakatsuka A, et al. Journal of Hepatology 1999;30:660-668. Yamakado K, Nakatsuka A, Tanaka N, et al. Radiology 2001;220:150-156

slide.title: Clinical benefit of PV stenting
slide.text:
Clinical benefit of PV stenting Reduction of PV pressure 1. Improvement of symptoms caused by portal hypertension Gastroesophageal variceal bleeding Refractory ascites Superior mesenteric vein congestion and bowel edema Malabsorption 2. Palliative PV stent placement in patients with malignant PV obstruction → may prolong survival and improve their general condition
Yamakado K, Tanaka N, Nakatsuka A, et al. Journal of Hepatology 1999;30:660-668. Yamakado K, Nakatsuka A, Tanaka N, et al. Radiology 2001;220:150-156

slide.title: EUS-guided PV stenting in animal model
slide.titleNormalized: eus-guided pv stenting in animal model
slide.text:
PV stenting has been performed by interventional radiologists via percutaneous access route.
The aim of the present study was to examine the technical feasibility and safety of EUS-guided transhepatic PV stent placement in a live animal model.
EUS-guided PV stenting in animal model Park TY, Seo DW, Kang HJ, et al. Endoscopic Ultrasound 2016 In press

slide.title: EUS-guided PV stenting in animal model
slide.titleNormalized: eus-guided pv stenting in animal model
slide.text: Materials Male miniature pigs (Sus scrofus domesticus) (8–10 months old; 25 kg) 2) Forward-viewing curvilinear array echoendoscope (XGIF-UCT160J-AL5; Olympus Medical Systems, Japan) EUS processor (EU-ME1; Olympus Medical Systems, Japan) 19G FNA needle (Expect™ 19ga Flex Needle; Boston Scientific Co., Natick, MA, United States) 5) 0.025-inch GW (VisiGlide; Olympus Medical Systems, Japan) EUS-guided PV stenting in animal model Park TY, Seo DW, Kang HJ, et al. Endoscopic Ultrasound 2016 In press

slide.title: EUS-guided PV stenting
slide.text: EUS-guided PV stenting EUS-guided transhepatic PV stent placement can be both technically feasible and safe in a live animal model.

slide.title: Contents
slide.text: Contents 1) EUS-guided PV stenting 2) EUS-guided PV embolization 3) EUS-guided PV pressure measurement

slide.title: PV embolization
slide.text:
PV embolization Preoperative Percutaneous transhepatic PV embolization was first introduced in 1986 in HCC patient scheduled for hepatic resection.
Preoperative percutaneous transhepatic PV embolization has been performed in major liver resections to increase remnant liver volume. → Post-operative hepatic failure Kinoshita H, Sakai K, Hirohashi K, et al. World J Surg 1986;10:803-808. Makuuchi M, Thai BL, Takayasu K, et al. Surgery 1990;107:521-527.

slide.title: Major liver resections
slide.text: Major liver resections Siriwardena, A. K. et al. Nat. Rev. Clin. Oncol. 2014;11:446–459.

slide.title: Indication for PV embolization
slide.text:
Indication for PV embolization Major liver resections → Rt. hepatectomy or extended Rt. hepatectomy Hepatocellular carcinoma Hilar bile duct cancer Intrahepatic bile duct cancer Liver metastasis of colorectal cancer
Kinoshita H, Sakai K, Hirohashi K, et al. World J Surg 1986;10:803-808. Makuuchi M, Thai BL, Takayasu K, et al. Surgery 1990;107:521-527. Siriwardena, A. K. et al. Nat. Rev. Clin. Oncol. 2014;11:446–459.

slide.title: EUS-guided PV embolization in animal model
slide.titleNormalized: eus-guided pv embolization in animal model
slide.text:
The aim of the present study was to evaluate the technical feasibility and initial safety of EUS-guided PV embolization in animal model.
EUS-guided PV embolization in animal model

slide.title: EUS-guided PV embolization
slide.text: EUS-guided PV embolization EUS-guided intrahepatic PV embolization using coil and histoacryl can be both technically feasible and initially safe in a live animal model.

slide.title: Contents
slide.text: Contents 1) EUS-guided PV stenting 2) EUS-guided PV embolization 3) EUS-guided PV pressure measurement

slide.title: Portal hypertension
slide.text:
Portal hypertension Pathologic increase in portal vein pressure Important and serious adverse event of liver cirrhosis Complications: gastroesophageal variceal bleeding, ascites, hepatic encephalopathy, hepatorenal syndrome
→ PV pressure can be important clinical information in management of complications of portal hypertension Portal hypertension Abraldes JG, Tarantino I, Turnes J, et al. Hepatology 2003;37:902-908.

slide.title: PV pressure measurement
slide.text:
PV pressure measurement 1. Direct PV pressure - Percutaneous transhepatic portal vein puncture - Technically difficulty and high rate of adverse events → Not routinely performed in clinical practice.
2. Indirect PV pressure - Percutaneous transjugular approach - Hepatic venous pressure gradient (HVPG) = Wedge hepatic vein pressure – Free hepatic vein pressure
Perello A, Escorsell A, Bru C, et al. Hepatology 1999;30:1393-1397. Schulman AR, Thompson CC, Ryou M. Gastrointest Endosc 2016;83:817-820.

slide.title: PV pressure measurement
slide.text:
PV pressure measurement Limitations of hepatic venous pressure gradient (HVPG) Invasive Performed only in specialized centers Not always accurately reflect PV pressure
Valla D, Bercoff E, Menu Y, et al. Gastroenterology 1984;86:1400-1403. Schulman AR, Thompson CC, Ryou M. Gastrointest Endosc 2016;83:817-820.

slide.title: EUS-guided direct PV pressure measurement
slide.text: EUS-guided direct PV pressure measurement Schulman AR, Thompson CC, Ryou M. Gastrointest Endosc 2016;83:817-820.

slide.title: EUS-guided direct PV pressure measurement
slide.text: EUS-guided direct PV pressure measurement Schulman AR, Thompson CC, Ryou M. Gastrointest Endosc 2016;83:817-820. Materials Yorkshire pigs (40-55 kg) 2) Linear array echoendoscope (Pentax EG-387OUTK; Hitachi Preirus System, Montvale, NJ, USA) 3) 22-gauge FNA needle (Beacon BNX system, Medtronic,Minneapolis, Minn)

- PressureWire Aeris; St. Jude Medical, St. Paul, Minn, United States
https://www.sjmglobal.com Digital pressure wire Digital pressure wire

Percutaneous transjugular approach Methods Hepatic venous pressure gradient * Hepatic venous pressure gradient (HVPG) = Wedge hepatic vein pressure – Free hepatic vein pressure

slide.title: EUS-guided direct PV pressure measurement
slide.text: EUS-guided direct PV pressure measurement Schulman AR, Thompson CC, Ryou M. Gastrointest Endosc 2016;83:817-820. No hemodynamic instability during procedures. No evidence of bleeding on necropsy.

slide.title: EUS-guided direct PV pressure measurement
slide.text: EUS-guided direct PV pressure measurement EUS-guided direct portal pressure measurement → short-term safety and technical feasibility Schulman AR, Thompson CC, Ryou M. Gastrointest Endosc 2016;83:817-820.

slide.title: EUS-guided PV approach Advantages
slide.text:
EUS-guided PV approach Advantages Detailed image of the PV and adjacent vascular structures → allowing selection of the most preferable port of entry.
2. Color Doppler and pulse-wave Doppler: real-time blood flow characteristics → help to detect abnormal vascular flow.
3. Use of Color Doppler → reduce dose of contrast, risk of nephrotoxicity, and exposure to radiation. Park TY, Seo DW, Kang HJ, et al. Endoscopic Ultrasound 2016 In press

slide.title: EUS-guided PV approach Limitations
slide.text:
EUS-guided PV approach Limitations Healthy animals (without portal hypertension and coagulopathy) were used; Risk of bleeding may have been underestimated.
2. Most of the devices used in EUS-guided vascular intervention were designed for biliary intervention.
3. Lack of sterility is a potential drawback of procedures; This could result in bacteremia and affect survival in immunocompromised cases. Park TY, Seo DW, Kang HJ, et al. Endoscopic Ultrasound 2016 In press

slide.title: Conclusions
slide.text:
Conclusions EUS-guided PV intervention including PV stenting, PV embolization, direct PV pressure measurement is technically feasible and initially safe in an animal model.
Further studies for safety of EUS-guided PV intervention are needed before it can be considered for clinical application in portal hypertensive and coagulopathic condition.
More research and development of devices dedicated to EUS-guided vascular intervention is needed.

slide.title: Thank you for your kind attention

slide.text: Thank you for your kind attention.
